security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill definition file (SKILL.md) with no executable code, scripts, or network capabilities. All functionality is achieved through prompt instructions and existing MCP tools (Rube). No security concerns identified.

content.user_title: Create and share Claude skills on Slack
content.value_statement: Teams waste time manually sharing newly created skills with colleagues. This skill automates skill creation with proper structure and instantly notifies your team on Slack through Rube integration.
actual_capabilities: Creates properly structured skill directories with SKILL.md templates
Generates scripts/, references/, and assets/ subdirectories automatically
Validates skill structure and metadata before distribution
Packages skills into distributable zip files
Shares created skills on Slack channels via Rube integration
limitations: Requires Rube MCP for Slack functionality
Does not publish skills to public repositories or marketplaces
Cannot create skills without proper naming conventions

use_cases.title: Standardize skill creation
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members create skills with consistent structure and automatic Slack notifications

use_cases.title: Automate skill pipelines
use_cases.description: Build internal tools that automatically create and distribute skills across your organization

use_cases.title: Track skill inventory
use_cases.description: Receive instant Slack notifications when new skills are created for visibility and discovery

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user wants to create a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use skill-share to create a new skill called [skill-name] with description: [description]

prompt_templates.title: Create with full structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive skill package named [skill-name] for [use-case] with validation and Slack notification

prompt_templates.title: Batch create skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Use skill-share to create these skills: [list of skill names and descriptions], then share them on our #skills channel

prompt_templates.title: Automated workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill named [name] with [description], validate its structure, package it, and notify the #engineering-team channel on Slack

output_examples.input: Create a skill called 'pdf-analyzer' that extracts text and images from PDF documents
output: Validated skill structure - all checks passed
Posted to Slack #skills channel: New Skill Created: pdf-analyzer - Extracts text and images from PDF documents

best_practices: Use descriptive hyphenated names that clearly indicate the skill's purpose
Provide detailed descriptions that help teammates understand skill capabilities
Validate skills locally before sharing with larger teams
anti_patterns: Creating skills without meaningful descriptions reduces discoverability
Skipping validation may result in malformed skill packages
Using vague names makes it difficult to find skills later

faq.question: What tools does skill-share work with?
faq.answer: Skill-share works with Claude Code and Rube MCP for Slack integration. Rube handles all Slack messaging.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without Slack?
faq.answer: Yes, skill creation and packaging work independently. Slack sharing requires Rube MCP configuration.

faq.question: Where are created skills stored?
faq.answer: Skills are created in the current working directory as skill-[name] folders with proper structure.

faq.question: Is my data safe when sharing on Slack?
faq.answer: Skill-share only shares metadata (name, description, file links) that you explicitly provide.

faq.question: Why is my skill failing validation?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing description, invalid name format, or missing required frontmatter fields in SKILL.md.

faq.question: How is this different from manual skill creation?
faq.answer: Skill-share automates directory creation, template generation, validation, packaging, and team notifications in one step.
